definitions.definition: A very small piece of matter, a fragment ; especially, the smallest possible part of something.
Any of various physical objects making up the constituent parts of an atom ; an elementary particle or subatomic particle .

A part of speech that has no inherent lexical definition but must be associated with another word to impart meaning, often a grammatical category: for example, the English word to in a full infinitive phrase ( to eat ) or O in a vocative phrase ( O Canada ), or as a discourse marker ( mmm ).
A part of speech which cannot be inflected .
In the Roman Catholic church, a crumb of consecrated bread ; also the smaller breads used in the communion of the laity .

main_definition: A very small piece of matter, a fragment ; especially, the smallest possible part of something. [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( physics ) Any of various physical objects making up the constituent parts of an atom ; an elementary particle or subatomic particle . [from 19th c.]

( grammar ) A part of speech that has no inherent lexical definition but must be associated with another word to impart meaning, often a grammatical category: for example, the English word to in a full infinitive phrase ( to eat ) or O in a vocative phrase ( O Canada ), or as a discourse marker ( mmm ).
( linguistics ) A part of speech which cannot be inflected .
( Christianity ) In the Roman Catholic church, a crumb of consecrated bread ; also the smaller breads used in the communion of the laity .
